solution_summary.title: Magnomer: A Design2Recycle
solution_summary.tagline: Design2Recycle: Magnetizable inks for enhanced recycling
solution_description: Beverage bottles, made from PET plastic, enjoy significant collection & recycle infrastructure in the US.
Yet bottle-to-bottle recycling rates are under 6% due to labels made from different plastics, which are the #1 contaminant in PET recycling.
Magnomer introduces magnetizable inks as a tool for plastic packaging, allowing for efficient separation of labels during recycling.
solution_summary.problem_statement: Less than 6% of all plastic PET bottles get recycled due to contamination from labels which complicates the recycling process.

technology.description: Our solution – magnetizable inks – allows for magnetic separation of label flake, improving the recycling yield from current industry averages.
technology.innovation: This approach allows for recyclability without altering existing manufacturing processes and helps achieve recycling within market constraints.
technology.core_technology: Combines knowledge from magnetism and printing inks.

benefits: Increased recycling yield, reduced environmental litter, and improved economic incentives for recycling.

barriers: Consumer brand buy-in for added ink costs.
Lack of cohesive regulation affecting packaging design.
strategies_to_overcome: Increase production volumes to reduce costs.
Engage in forums to influence policy.

solution.name: Carbicrete
solution.tagline: Cement-free carbon-negative concrete
solution.summary: Carbicrete is a Montreal-based cleantech company that develops innovative, low-cost building solutions that contribute to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions. Carbicrete’s patented technology enables the production of cement-free, carbon-negative concrete using industrial by-products and captured CO2. The company offers concrete manufacturers the process, materials, and support to make lower-cost, higher-quality precast concrete in a way that reduces their carbon footprint.
solution.problem: Concrete is the most used substance on Earth after water. A key ingredient in concrete has always been cement, the production of which accounts for over 8% of the world’s CO2 emissions.

solution_details.core_technology: Carbicrete’s technology enables the production of concrete without using cement. The process involves using steel slag as the primary binder and carbon dioxide as the activator in cement-free concrete.
solution_details.innovative_aspects: Carbicrete is the first company to develop a way to produce concrete without cement and by using industrial by-products. It offers a truly carbon-negative alternative to cement-based concrete.
solution_details.application: Carbicrete is working with concrete and steel manufacturers to establish a circular economy where the by-products of one industry become the raw material of the other.

achievements.technology_development: 10 years of research and development at McGill University.
achievements.pilot_stage: Pilot plant opening soon for industrial-scale production.

impact.sequestration: Each unit produced can sequester up to 1 kg of CO2.

9313.solution_title: Global Plastic Waste Deposit and Tracking System

solution_summary.tagline: A global plastic waste recycling ecosystem powered by blockchain technology
solution_summary.description: Inspired by the Norwegian plastic bottle recycling system, Empower tackles the plastic crisis by giving plastic a value through a blockchain-powered Global Plastic Waste Deposit & Tracking System. By rewarding the act of depositing, Empower incentivizes plastic collection in areas in great need, helps local communities overcome poverty by providing income opportunities, and uses blockchain to pave the way to a circular economy where plastic retains its value throughout various life cycles.

impact.long_term: Achieve a recycling rate up to 90% globally.

year_one: Pilot a digital deposit & waste management infrastructure/plastic waste tracking in several countries in Europe, Asia, and Africa
Launch the first retail products based on our digital tracking platform
five_years: Introduce plastic waste deposit systems in 60+ countries
Operate a growing digital waste tracking platform
Set up new digital deposit systems for other products

market_opportunity.problem: The global production of plastics is expected to double over the next 20 years, contributing to economic and environmental challenges.
market_opportunity.solution: An incentive-based collection and sorting effect of the digital deposit system that creates awareness and action/investments from local entrepreneurs and governments.

app.description: Empower mobile application for digital token handling.

barriers: Attractivity barrier: lack of incentive for individuals to collect plastic waste.
Technical barriers: user-friendly app design and data protection.
Legislative barriers: blockchain legislation and data protection issues.
barrier_solutions: Creating a tangible value for users through digital tokens.
Engaging stakeholders and local governments early in the process.
Ensuring compliance with local laws and regulations.

solution_overview.description: My solution is going to solve the problem of recycling plastic. This fabric can be used in the packaging industry to package goods. It will be lower cost than new LDPE woven and Non-Woven fabric.
solution_overview.method: Spread the resin on a polyester fabric and then plastic powder. It can also be made using shredded single-use plastic or powder from thermocole (EPS).

problem_statement: Recycled plastic powder (Hdpe) does not have virgin properties when reused, hence requires mixing with virgin plastic.
LDPE or PE stretch film after shredding needs to be molded again, which is environmentally dangerous.
There are no solutions for recycling Thermocole (EPS).
8640.target_audience: Packaging industry and workers engaged in plastic industries.

proposed_solution.flexibility: The fabric will be flexible and durable.
proposed_solution.pollution: Making process will be less pollutant as there is no need for heating and molding.
proposed_solution.cost: The cost of fabric will be one third of original products.

solution.name: 21st-Century Career Developers
solution.tagline: The Solution to Societal Inclusion and Shared Prosperity

solution_summary.description: Increasingly, higher education is out of the reach of the majority of people. CareerDevs allows traditional and non-consumers of education, anywhere in the world to gain 21-century skills online and pay via an income share agreement only if they land a relatively high-wage career in their country. Our proven low-cost model is already more than doubling the income of our students, in 12 months or less. Our solution can restore the middle class in countries such as the United States and enable poor 3rd-world nations to enter the developed world.

problem.description: Despite a steady increase in the number of 4-year college graduates, two-thirds of people in the United States do not have a college degree. The student loan debt crisis has reached $1.6 trillion, affecting many including seniors. The cost of education is rapidly increasing, making it unaffordable for many, while there is a growing number of high-wage jobs unfulfilled due to lack of skilled talent.

solution.target_audience: Non-consumers of traditional higher education, specifically those priced out of it.

solution_details.description: CareerDevs offers a Computer Science University that allows students to learn without paying upfront. They pay only when they secure a job earning a minimum of $50,000 annually. Graduates can earn an average of $70,000 annually through this model.

solution.goals: Demonstrate business models for extending the lifetime of products.

statistics.student_job_placement: Graduates pay only if they secure high-wage employment.

impact.students_influencing: Every graduate influences 2.7 new people to join CareerDevs.

solution.title: Plastic Eating Bacteria

solutionSummary.tagline: Utilizing gut bacterium from Zophobas Morio to rid the planet of certain types of plastic.
solutionSummary.description: Zophobas morio (superworms) have a gut bacterium that allows the worm to digest certain types of plastic and turn it into usable compost. Studies have shown the bacteria excrete a film that degrades the plastic.
solutionSummary.goal: To create a safe, natural way to remove over 60% of waste in landfills and oceans.

solution.problemAddressed: Reducing waste and the carbon emissions required to rid/recycle certain types of plastics by introducing plastic eating bacteria that have been modified to survive in the oceans' extreme environment.

technology.innovativeAspects: The solution utilizes nature's processes that were previously overlooked due to slow processes and lack of organizational benefit.
technology.scientificApproach: The project utilizes complex genetic structures and requires new bioreactor technology.

goals.nextYear: Understand the genetic mechanisms of the bacterium.
goals.nextFiveYears: Full genetic understanding and a scalable version.

impact.solutionsToChallenges: Creating numerous bioreactors and seeking investors.

statistics.wasteReduction: Hope to remove 60% of certain types of plastic waste.

9376.solution_summary: HI-Light is a solar-thermal chemical reactor technology for converting CO2 to fuels.
9376.pitch: The HI-Light reactor being developed at Cornell University is a solar-thermocatalytic 'reverse combustion' technology that enables the conversion of CO2 and water to methanol and other high-value hydrocarbons.
9376.problem_solving: The extraction and consumption of fossil carbon to run our daily lives accounts for over 6 billion metric tons of CO2 emissions each year. Creating high-value products from CO2 by utilizing solar energy to produce liquid hydrocarbons economically.
9376.target_audience: The major challenge of electrocatalysis is how to lower the overpotential with breakthroughs in new catalysts.
9376.innovative_aspects: The unique design feature of the HI-Light reactor optimizes light delivery to both a fixed and fluidized nanostructured catalyst, coupled with solar thermal heating to achieve higher efficiencies.
9376.core_technology: Optimized light delivery through internal light-guiding rods with specially designed scattering surfaces enables efficient penetration of solar radiation into the reactor.
achievements: Advanced into the final round of the $20 million NRG COSIA Carbon XPRIZE global competition
Approved for funding by Shell Oil through the Shell GameChanger program

recognitions: 30 Under 30 in Energy by Forbes Magazine (2018)

9107.solution_summary: Wastewater treatment is essential for maintaining a drinking water supply and preserving the health of natural watersheds. Our technology treats wastewater by upcycling waste organics into commercially valuable bioproducts. Our main product, polyhydroxyalkanoates, are microbial polyesters with applications similar to conventional plastics; however, if our bioplastics are not recycled, they will biodegrade in the natural environment.
9107.tagline: Waste into biomaterials: we provide a water treatment solution while creating new products.
9107.problem_addressed: We address the problem of increased and equitable production of renewable and recyclable raw materials for products and packaging, focusing on the palm oil industry's environmental impact.
9107.target_audience: Over 450 palm oil mills in Malaysia and more than 800 in Indonesia.
9107.technology_description: Our solution uses a series of bioreactors where natural microbes consume organic compounds to produce bioplastic. We have isolated over 70 bioplastic-producing microbes and tested them on various waste feedstocks.
9107.innovation: Our technology's innovation lies in its dual value proposition: providing wastewater treatment and bioplastic production at competitive costs compared to conventional plastics while also meeting environmental standards.

goals.next_year: Operational pilot plant demonstrating continuous treatment of wastewater and bioplastic production.
goals.next_five_years: First commercial-scale plant operational within one year of pilot completion.

barriers: Finding the right palm oil mill partner for on-site technology demonstrations.
Fluctuations in palm oil prices affecting capital investment.
9107.plans_to_overcome_barriers: Working with government and research agencies to identify the right palm oil mill partner and seek approvals for government programs that provide tax advantages for adopting new technologies.
9107.business_model: Deploying technology through direct licensing to palm oil mills or as part of a technology package provided by an engineering partner, along with purchasing crude bioplastic for refinement.
9107.path_to_financial_sustainability: Initial investment capital raise combined with grants to fund the pilot plant, followed by licensing revenues and purchase contracts for crude bioplastic.

partnership_potential.reason_for_applying_to_solve: To connect with partners in design, product development, regulation, and environmental innovation.

9107.initial_serving_population: Approximately 450 palm oil mills in Malaysia.
9107.five_year_serving_population: Potentially serving much larger volumes as access to other feedstocks is expanded.
9107.title: Bioplastic production from wastewater

Optimization using branch and bound algorithms (using GAMS and python interface)

Supply Chain Scale: Model-based decision-making required for recycling methods.
Economy Scale: Designing pathways accounting for tax and product bans.
innovation: The integrated life cycle analysis methodology for pathway design.

solution.problem_solved: As we shift to progressively US only resources for recycling as China raises its rates for accepting US recycled exports, there is financial advantages to shipping (used) plastic by weight rather than by volume. summary.overview: The project aims to solve the issue of improper waste management in the country. Approximately less than 20% of the waste produced is recycled due to the lack of a proper waste management system.

solution.problem: Solid waste management is a significant problem in Ghana. With less than 30% of city inhabitants having access to collection services, and fewer than 5% of waste being recycled, health issues arise due to improper disposal.

solutionDetails.approach: Educating community members on waste classification, selective disposal, and selling classified waste to recycling companies to create jobs.
developmentStages: Collection of plastic waste and papers

impact.targetPopulation: General public, aiming to reach at least 60% of the community population.

goals.oneYear: Educate parents through children about sustainable waste management.
goals.fiveYears: Expand to reach 300 schools out of 475 senior high schools in Ghana.

impact.expectedReduction: Aim to recycle about 80% of the waste produced.

achievements.currentReach: Working with senior high schools, each having around 1000 students.

solution.barriers: Lack of financial support for materials and tools, and engaging people who are busy or unaware of the importance of waste management.
solution.partnerships: Currently partnering with three recycling companies in Ghana.

media.support: Government of Ghana, Ministry of Water Resource and Sanitation, World Health Organization

goals.immediate: Integrate low-cost solar storage solutions across targeted sectors.
goals.long_term: Establish CLIMATENZA as a leader in dispatchable renewable energy market.

solution.name: Wazi Vision
solution.tagline: Wazi recycles plastic waste to manufacture affordable recyclable eye wear for low income communities in Africa.
solution.summary: In Uganda and most of Africa, eye care is very expensive and not affordable for 80% of the population. An average pair of glasses costs $150, yet the average household income is $40 per month. This makes it impossible for low-income individuals to afford basic eye care. Wazi recycles 1-2 tons of plastic waste each week into stylish, durable, and affordable eyewear. If scaled globally, this could eliminate over 8 tons of waste weekly while providing access to affordable eye care.

Manufacturing using plastic injection molding technology.
Distribution and upcycling of old frames.

goals.next_five_years: Achieve Africa wide reach and increased production.

current: Technical challenges in recycling more types of plastic.
overcome: Hiring a consultant for technical support.

Solution Summary.Name: Chemolex Company
Solution Summary.Tagline: Application of advanced biotechnology to produce affordable and biodegradable bioplastics from the invasive water hyacinth plant.
Solution Summary.Overview: Chemolex Company solves the existing ecological, economic, climatic, and environmental challenges caused by plastic pollution by applying its patented bio-conversion technology to produce biodegradable bioplastics.

Technology.Core Technology: Advanced bio-conversion technology involving two strains of bio-engineered enzymes.
Technology.Process: The water hyacinth is removed from the lake, chopped, and subjected to pre-hydrolysis before enzymatic conversion.

Impact.Ecological: Helps eradicate the invasive water hyacinth plant which depletes oxygen from lakes.
Impact.Health: Reduces consumer exposure to harmful microplastics.
Impact.Economic: Produces biodegradable bioplastics that are 60% more affordable than conventional options.

Goals.1-Year Goals: Produce 7 tons of biodegradable bioplastics monthly, targeting 300 food companies.
Goals.5-Year Goals: Supply biodegradable bioplastics to 160,000 grocery vendors and 1,000 food companies, reducing plastic waste by 35 million tons annually.

Achievements.Current Production: 200 kg of biodegradable bioplastics for 10 food companies and 20 grocery vendors monthly.
Achievements.Future Projections: 7 tons of biodegradable food packaging in one year.

Partnerships: Chandaria Business Innovation and Incubation Center

solution_details.solution_name: Agar-agar and agarose fibers for fashion industry
solution_details.solution_tagline: Agar-agar and agarose fibers as a circular economy solution for the textile industry
solution_details.solution_overview: The textile business is considered one of the most polluting in the world. It is responsible for the use of non-biodegradable materials by the disposal of several toxic metals in soil, water and air, as well as the use of large volumes of water. This project proposes the production of biodegradable fibers to be inserted inside textile industries productive cycles. The materials explored are the polymers Agar and Agarose.
solution_details.problem_solving: To reduce the environmental effects of uncontrolled production of petroleum-based plastics requires more sustainable options for renewable resources. As an ecological alternative, bioplastics have attracted widespread attention.
solution_details.target_audience: This project targets the textile import market, particularly involving Brazil and China.
solution_details.solution_innovation: The proposal of this project is to use agar polymers and agarose for the development of textile fibers on an industrial scale. Agar and agarose are biodegradable polymers with unique characteristics suitable for biomaterials.

goals.short_term: Design and produce mass-market clothing and apparel through circular processes.
goals.long_term: Expand the use of biodegradable materials in the textile industry globally.

team_details.headquarter: São Paulo, State of São Paulo, Brazil

solution.name: dHope!
solution.tagline: Encouraging sustainability among youths through fashion and style.
solution.summary: Through fashion, dHope! reduces the amount of waste that is released into the streets every day by 85%. Now, instead of throwing trash out the window when no one is looking and littering the streets, you can send in your trash and have it turned into a bracelet or a mouse pad just like magic! We accept plastic, old leather and fabric, rubber footwear, fading jewelry, as well as worn-out vehicle spare parts. These materials are cleaned and redecorated to make beautiful fashion pieces and accessories.

9080.solutionTitle: Green Haathi to Make Earth Green

9080.pitch: Huge waste produced form cities have created enormous pressure on environment. In existing post-processing mechanism only 30% of the collected waste gets recycled and remaining 70% send to dumping site. This is due the sever mixing of different types of waste. This has a challenge of waste transportation and scarcity of raw material.
9080.problemStatement: Waste management is among of the major challenges, having sever impact on environment and health. The genesis of huge quantity of solid waste to dump in land fill sites is lies in the method used for waste segregated.
9080.whoAreYouServing: The present model is to establish for 50 food outlets, each having per day 400-600 customers. The estimated waste generation per day is 1.5-2 tonnes.
9080.solutionDetails: In the proposed solution is based on a new technology, called Green Haathi, to process and segregate the waste at the generation site.
9080.innovation: We provide a tech-driven solution to handle the waste, which is generally ignore to process in conventional method of waste management.
9080.coreTechnology: The present solution is based on a new technology, named Green Haathi, that processes and segregates waste at the generation site using solar energy and IoT for input parameter monitoring.

Create awareness to minimize waste for dumping sites
nextFiveYears: Prepare machine to handle other types of waste
Operate in multiple places and serve for more than 10 million.
Reduce the waste from food outlet and other sources.

nextYear: Unawareness for responsibility of waste producer
Tendency of randomly parking of waste
Reluctance to invest in such technology.
nextFiveYears: Education and training of informal waste pickers

plansToOvercomeBarriers: Regular classes for waste pickers to obtain primary education
Testing and installment of Green Haathi
9080.businessModel: The installation cost is covered by stakeholders, with regular revenue generated from raw material sales and waste processing charges.
9080.pathToFinancialSustainability: Revenue will be obtained through the sale of produced raw material, and compost.

9291.solutionTitle: IPO Tables – Connecting The Dots For Circularity
9291.solutionSummary: IPO is a very simple software that allows to solve the circular economy's most urgent question - how to make outputs inputs again - in the most elegant way imaginable.
9291.tagline: IPO creates the language for objects for a sustainable circular zero waste world.

technologyDetails.coreTechnology: The result will be a responsive Web App. The frontend is implemented with React. The visualization of the cycles is done by JavaScript and the library D3.js. The backend is implemented with Java Spring. Authorization and authentication is done via Spring Security with OAuth. Frontend and backend communicate via REST APIs and SPARQL queries.

9291.problemAddressed: Many production or uses processes have outputs that end up as waste because no one knows how to use them. IPO enables through open collaboration to find and create reuse opportunities for almost everything.

goals.nextYear: Proof of concept. A huge database with products.
goals.fiveYears: Open source software. Foster a culture and ecosystem that utilizes transparent and open documentation of objects and processes.

9291.barriers: Time and money. The team is currently too busy with earning rent to put the needed time into the project.
overcomingBarriers: Create motivation when people start using it and find it useful.
9291.teamStrengths: The team includes two capable coders and one marketing & community person with a strong network.

solutionSummary.solutionOverview: barePack was created from the frustration of some nature loving individuals upon witnessing the abundance of disposable, single use plastics involved in our daily consumption, particularly in Southeast Asia where the founding team of barePack lives. We have imagined a practical day-to-day solution to make meals more sustainable and fight disposable cups and food boxes, by leveraging the power of the sharing economy.

problemSolving.problem: Packaging waste, which includes single-use disposables such as plastic bags and food packaging represent about one-third of the total waste disposed of by households in a city like Singapore. These disposables unnecessarily contribute to fuel ill-adapted waste management cycles and result in avoidable greenhouse gas emissions and air pollution.

solutionDetails.method: The positive impact of reusables over single use food packaging is well documented and proven. barePack proposes an alternative to reduce the amount of waste produced in the first place, most of which is completely unnecessary.

solution_summary.title: Circular Economy of Plastics
solution_summary.tagline: Temperature and pressure driven recombination of plastics and organics into virgin chemicals to be reused in current industry.
solution_summary.problem_solving: Plastic waste accumulation in landfills and oceans.

impact_goals.short_term_goals: Raise between 50,000 to 200,000 euro in soft funds to properly develop the technology.

current_operations.people_served: Still in the R&D stage; prototyping and testing will take years.

barriers.funding_needs: Need funding to buy tailor-made equipment and test results.
barriers.searching_for_support: Applying for soft funds and seeking mentors in the field.
